headline: Slow Cooker Beef Stew
description: This easy slow cooker beef stew recipe made with potatoes, carrots, celery, broth, herbs, and spices is hearty and comforting.

video.description: This easy slow cooker beef stew recipe made with potatoes, carrots, celery, broth, herbs, and spices is hearty and comforting. You won't be slow to say 'yum' after making the simple crock pot recipe in this video, and neither will the family!
video.name: How to Make Slow Cooker Beef Stew

name: Slow Cooker Beef Stew
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds beef stew meat, cut into 1-inch pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Mix flour, salt, and pepper together in a small bowl. Pour over meat, and stir until meat is coated.
Add beef broth, carrots, potatoes, onion, celery, Worcestershire sauce, paprika, garlic, and bay leave; stir to combine.
Cover, and cook until beef is tender enough to cut with a spoon, on Low for 8 to 12 hours, or on High for 4 to 6 hours.

review.reviewBody: I follow the recipe but substituted celery for coasely chopped green peppers added a package of fresh button mushrooms and omitted the bay leaf. I then made mashed red potatoes, boiled with the skin on and peeled before mashing, adding butter and sour cream while mashing. The stew mixture more resembled a goulash than a stew. Made a bed of mashed potatoes and poured the goulash over it. We loved it!!!

This was very delicious however, I made it on the stove in a big dutch oven due to time constraint. I browned the meat in the flour mixture with the chopped onions, added minced garlic until browned, red wine with other ingredients and it was a keeper. My husband said his favorite stew yet! (married 41 years)
Delicious AS WRITTEN. I didn't change a thing.

I put a few more ingredients to it. Some people were complaining about it being bland. I never make a recipe exact. You need to jazz it up a bit. Add more seasonings to it. Make it your own. Otherwise, it's a great, tasty recipe. Just jazz it up a bit ✌️

I followed the directions to the letter. I’m happy to report that my wife and teenage son loved it. I bought a crusty bread to go with it and the whole meal was a success. My wife packed a serving to have tomorrow for lunch. She also packed a serving for her friend that likes stew. She has never packed a portion for anyone else, that tells me it was a hit. Thank you!

Everything about the ingredients and cooking was perfect except it’s missing “zip”. It’s bland. I added hot sauce while the wife who doesn’t like spicy ate it the way it was. Gotta think of a way to liven it up next time which will be soon.
Easy to follow and simple to make although I did add extra liquid and flower just enough to cover the ingredients.
Easy to make and oh, so yummy! Will definitely make it again.
Easy to make and absolutely delicious!, I added turnips and topped with cabbage. Yummy!

Love this recipe. I like to serve it over polenta. yuuuuum. Making it today for lunch. I just scrolled through the reviews. I believe the people having difficulty with dry meat, etc are using an instapot, based on pics. Instapot and crockpot (or slow cooker) do not work the same. You may need to adjust the recipe time and temp to your appliance. This would also work great simmered on the stove.
Only thing I didn't put in was celery. I put in pea's instead
Absolutely amazing. Allrecipes is my go to for recipes. Always scrumptious. Thanks😋

I turn to google recipes for ideas based on what I have. I used this as a base. Used 2 cups water, 2 TBS peanut butter, 1 TBS Worcestershire. 1.5 TSP Hot Paprika. Stirred in a heaping TBS of instant Chicken Broth. Very pleased. Thank you for the post!
It was a good basic recipe to add on to. I found it a bit bland so I'll tweak it next time by adding spices and other vegetables like turnip.
This is a go to recipe for me. Only changes are add more broth and red wine. I also spice it up a bit more.
Comfort food! When your husband and kids try it and close their eyes, it is a good sign. I was in a hurry so I used packets of McCormick beef stew seasoning instead.

This recipe is perfect as is. I love the flavor Worchestershire sauce adds. This is my go to recipe for beef stew, but I change it up sometimes based on what I have at hand. I added a little purple cabbage and fresh mushrooms this time with a bit more broth.
This is a great recipe. I added about 1/2 cup of pepperoncini's and a probably 1/2 teas. of cumin. Delicious!
I followed the recipe exactly, and my family found it quite bland. When we try it again, we will double most of the spices. We'll also had 2 more carrots and 2 more stalk of celery.

This is the third time I've made this. I did end up adding the whole carton of broth and added a little Cajun seasoning the last time because my family just likes it. This is one of their favorite meals.
No changes. Came out awesome!!!
My family loves this! I don't bother with the bay leaf and used a TBSP soya sauce as I didn't have Worcestershire sauce and I've made it 3 times this way. It's been perfect every time!!!
Very good stew. I added an extra pound of meat and stew seasoning packets for flavor. Sure was good!
Great stew! I've been making this for about 2 years now and it's perfect for me. I always makes it exactly by the recipe. Easy to make and down right delicious!

I absolutely love this recipe! I do make some of my own changes now, but I've been using this as my base for years. It's rich, and hearty, and filling. All you could ask for in a stew honestly. I add a tiny bit more broth and some additional veggies, and some extra spices. But I made it without the tweaks for a long time and that in itself was delicious.
The taste was very bland. It tasted like almost no seasoning. None of my family liked ir.
I found it to be lacking flavor I even added more broth, more worchestire sauce and a bouillon cube.
Good recipe but I did add peas at the end of cooking time.
Great recipe.. I added 3.5 pounds of beef and the entire beef broth container since I wanted more broth. Everyone enjoyed it.

Traditional Beef Stew like my Mom used to make. Fantastic! I do not use the flour because I am wheat free, but add 1/2 tsp of Xanthan gum if needed before I serve to thicken or I let it cook a little longer so the smaller potatoes can thicken. Thanks! Love it!

This had good flavor, but not enough liquid for the amount of beef and vegetables I had (and I only had 2 potatoes and 1.3 pounds of beef). But it was tasty and I will make it again -- I will just add more broth next time.
I browned the beef and poured of the fat. Extra step but worth the time.

This is the only recipe I have used for beef stew for a few years now. Tender meat, excellent flavors and overall a great hit whenever I have people over or deliver it to anyone. 10 out of 10 if I could give it 10 stars! Definitely recommend!
excellent, pluse froze enough for another meal - used ziplock bags
Easy to make. 4 hours in the slow cooker. Tasteful. I making it again tonight. I added a little hot sauce on the plate. Gave it a little kick. Just a little hot sauce.

A great easy recipe that will satisfy the whole family. I agree with the previous post, needs more flavor so I increased salt (1 1/2 tsp, 1 tsp pepper, garlic (4 gloves) & Worchester amounts. I also added some garlic powder to the flour mixture.

This was so easy but it did need more flavor and veggies. -2 teaspoons salt and pepper or more -6 carrots (larger chunks) -4 celery stalks -2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce -4-6 potatoes depending on size -1 tablespoon ground paprika -1 teaspoon oregano -4-6 clove garlic -2 bay leaves Would consider adding peas and corn midway through if we make again. Mushrooms, parsnips or cauliflower might be good too. Cooked on high for 4 hours and it was good especially considering you don’t need to brown the meat before.
I just made this and it was awesome. I didn't have beef broth so I used beef boullion and water. Will definitely make this again (with the beef broth). New family favorite!!!! 😀
I added a packet of beef stew with everything and some peas. It was really good!

Was amazing!!! My husband said it was the best beef stew I ever made….ha who knew!!! Was sooo easy and flavorful. I followed exact recipe (just added some garlic powder too) and cooked for about 5 hours. It’s a must make!
The only change I made to this recipe was I used 1 pound of stew meat and didn't put celery in it. It was delicious. My husband and I both liked it. We have enough leftover for a second meal.

I added a lot more garlic 4 cloves, a can of diced tomatoes with green chilis, a small chunk of ginger, fresh peas, and I sauteed the onion celery and diced carrots and browned the meat before putting it in the crock pot. It was then better than okay, yummy with homemade cornbread (not the sweet sugar kind, the GOOD kind make with buttermilk).
Good recipe but add 3 tablespoons of horseradish sauce and you will be in love with it.
Easy recipe.
I added mushrooms and more veggies!
My wife and I liked this recipe a lot. Made it with a chuck roast, other than that made it as written. Next time I will leave out the bay leaf, not a fan.
Good and hearty, perfect fall dish.
I love this recipe, I may make one or two chances depending on my available ingredients every time I make it but nothing to sacrifice the taste. It’s delicious just as it is!
Great flavor, super easy.
We added stewed tomatoes and mushrooms! Great with corn muffins.

To my family, it lacked seasoning. It was very bland when recipe was complete so I added more worchestershire sauce, garlic and onion powder, more fresh ground pepper and a can of tomato sauce, much better for us.

This was extremely easy and came out great. I almost messed it up. I read it as 1-1/4 cups of flour. Luckily I caught it and fixed it before I added any liquids. I did add a little cornstarch slurry to thicken it at the end.

As is, it’s an okay recipe if you want an easy, no hassle meal. I liked that part of it, and with so many positive reviews, I had to check it out. For my family, it wasn’t very rich in flavor, rather it was kinda blah. To get more favor though, requires more effort. It would have been nice if this easier recipe worked out, but I’m going back to my tried and true classic French version with red wine, more spices, and browning/searing the meat first. To me, it’s worth the extra effort. Glad I tried it though and thank you for your recipe!

This recipe is straight-up great as it is. I did make one enhancement. Every year, at the holidays, I splurge on a prime rib roast. It's worth the extra money on the condition that I'll use every bit of it. So I added the prime rib bones to the stew, and added all the remaining au jus to the beef broth. It was absolutely exquisite; after 12 hours, the stubborn prime rib meat just fell off the bone, and the au jus permeates the entire presentation. Amish noodles are a nice addition as well.
Used an outside round pot roast and cut it up into pieces. I added a bit more potatoes and carrots and added a cup of peas one hour before serving just to stretch the meat.
Great Stew! easy to make and pretty much followed the entire list provided. Thank you, and I will make again.

I'm giving it 5 stars because it turned out great and like a previous person mentioned, my picky eater surely did eat it up! My only modification was to add water instead of beef stock. I have to watch sodium intake so I removed that and although I thought it would be bland it was enough with the salt amt and W. sauce in the recipe. Thank you!!
Delicious
This recipe is great just as written. I had a packet of beef stew seasoning that I added but it really didn’t need it

I have used this recipe many times over the years, and never change a thing. I have only made minor adjustments if I use more meat. Even my stew despising teens love it! To me: once I start using packets, it's not homemade. I'm sure the alterations are good, I just don't think they're necessary.

Good base recipe. Next time I'll use a can of crushed tomatoes instead of the diced tomatoes/tomato sauce combo since that was a little too acidic for me, and likely add mushrooms. Otherwise, turned out great.
Added an extra 1/4 cup of Worcestershire sauce. It was fantastic!
ok
Loved this recipe. Made plenty for two and enough to freeze the leftover!
It was a good base recipe, but I felt like it was missing some flavor. I definitely would have added more spices and will do that the next time I make this dish.

I made this recipe and with a couple minor adjustments, we loved it! I rolled the beef in the flour, salt and pepper, I seared it in my Ninja crock pot, then added the veggies. I added mushrooms, one large potato… I didn’t have beef broth, so while I ran out to the store, I put in three bullion cubes and a cup and a half of hot water. I was worried about flavor and saltiness, so i got some Swanson’s beef broth and put a good splash over the whole stew. I cooked everything together for four hours on high. It was amazing!
Made as described, and it is very very very basic - which will appeal to some but the end result was a little unexceptional to me. It comes together really easily though, which is a plus.

This was a fabulous recipe!!
I mixed the dry ingredients in a bowl and coated the beef in the bowl then put it in the crockpot.
I also added a package of McCormick's Beef Stew seasoning for fullness.
IT WAS AMAZING!!
Instead of cut up onions I use pearl onions as I like the flavor of them.
This is my go to beef stew recipe and I make it several times a year.
I'm gluten intolerant. So, I made it without the flour and didn't change anything. I just thickened with cornstarch at the end. It smelled great all day and tasted just as good.
Too much pepper and not enough other seasoning. Not enough liquid. Overall really bland and disappointing.

First I have to say I agree with the comments of changing recipe, I basically look at the helpful hint for possibly adjusting measurements. For the comments it taste like a regular Beef Stew what did you expect it to taste like! This stew was exactly what I wanted and simple to put together. The only thing I did different was due to my inability to follow simple directions. I seasoned the meat with seasoning that I chose (onion and celery and garlic powder) instead of mixing salt and pepper with flour. I ended up adding additional seasoning to the stock and vegetables and I did all prep work night before except broth and Worcestershire sauce. Next morning in between trying to get out of house on time I added liquid, plugged crockpot in. The smell in my house was heavenly.
It is good as is, but we like a little more seasoning, which I added at the end of cooking which, by the way, only took 5 hours on low in my slow cooker.

DRY AND BLAND - I followed this recipe exactly as written and it was the driest meat I've ever had and it literally has no flavor. I'm hoping to fix it with some onion soup mix and some beef broth but 1/10 would not recommend. If I could give this recipe a ZERO I WOULD BUT THATS NOT POSSIBLE SO I GIVE THIS A ONE.
Was great. A little less meat or more liquid. Either way great! Would like to try with venison.
Easy to start and leave until you are ready for it.
Tried this recipe and it really upped my stew game!!
My family loved this beef stew!

I had stew beef that I wanted to use up so that recipe seemed like a good fit. I floured and browned the beef before placing in crockpot. Pretty much followed the recipe exactly except I used a shallot in place of an onion. I cooked it on high 5 hours and it had no flavor. I ran out to get the Lawry’s beef stew seasoning as some suggested and it helped a tiny bit bit overall it was nasty. The beef wasn’t tender nor were the carrots. Total disappointment and a waste of time preparing.
My boyfriend loved it. I thought it was bland and tasteless to the point of .... you take the leftovers. To each their own.

My husband said it the the best stew I’ve made. While the spices were the same, I did add a single serve bottle of Cab Sauv, a regular size can of diced tomatoes and extra carrots and celery to stretch for 8 servings, because my husband invited some friends over for dinner. I did brown the flour coated beef and onions then threw everything together, brought to a boil then put it in a 275 degree oven for 3 hours as I didn’t have all day. I do believe the stew would have been awesome without my additions.
Recipe was great!! I would cut off an hour cooking time.
Amazing: easy and tasty!
I added twice as many veggies, garlic and broth, cooked on high 5 hours. Really good.
It came out very good! I doubled the recipe and had leftovers.
It was easy to make that a very good taste and the best part I came home to dinner
I substituted onion soup mix for beef broth and salt.
Yum I make it all the time. It's awesome.

Simple recipe. Tasted great. 

Suggest 1/2 Worcestershire Sauce. 

Double paprika. 

1 can hard cider (dry cider, NOT sweet!)

Roast garlic first. 

Half hand full Zante currents (or small box of raisons.)

Cooked on high for 4 hours, the carrots and potatoes were not tender. on high for 6 hours they were fine.
Needed more broth, and there was not much flavor. would consider making again, but with changes.

I was looking for an easy beef stew and I found it. Stew was bland and was more like a soup then stew. Needs a great deal of doctoring to make it a good stew. I will be looking else where for a new stew.
Doesn't really have any flavor
A winner at my house!
Easy and delicious!

I made this almost exactly to the recipe. The only changes were a pinch of oregano, extra potatoes, and extra broth (because of the potatoes.) Turned out pretty good, with a pinch of Mrs. Dash on top when served. I have to admit I was a little scared of putting the meat in the crock pot raw, but it turned out great!
I'm not sure what I did wrong. I followed the recipe exactly and found it to be extremely bland and just not good at all. I was very disappointed.
I love this recipe and remake it often!! I do omit the onions entirely and my family loves it. Severe onion allergies in our household. The flavor is delicious and mouth watering!!

No idea why this turned out to be such a disaster. After 6 hours on low (new crockpot brand) the veggies were very overcooked and the meat somewhat overcooked. Should have had more broth also, was starting to stick. Yes, it was absolutely on low.
Tasted great even with my no salt modification.

This was fantastic all the way down the line. I forgot the bay leaf, it's what I get for doing this on a short break from working at home. That being said, after eight hours on low in a crock pot the meat was tender but juicy, the vegetables fully done and the broth/stew liquid good enough to drink on it's own.
